DOC.brief_title: Motivational Interviewing Women ` Pelvic Wellness Education
DOC.detailed_description: Pelvic floor disorder significantly affect woman 's quality life , yet many feel uncomfortable openly discuss topic . Treatments include lifestyle modification , medication , and/or surgery . `` Decisional conflict '' arise patient difficulty choose several viable treatment option . Factors contribute decisional conflict include bias information , poor peer support , unaddressed fear . Effective counselling may help address factor . There study decision coach help woman prolapse incontinence reach satisfactory decision treatment . This study aim use principal share decision make address decisional conflict surround treatment pelvic floor disorder . Specifically , investigator evaluate feasibility acceptability small group workshops pelvic organ prolapse urinary incontinence lead nurse continence advisor psychologist ( decision coach ) . Results study inform future development interdisciplinary , patient-centered approach enhance decision make woman 's health .
DOC.criteria: Women age > 18 year old Urinary incontinence and/or pelvic organ prolapse First visit urogynecologist Anal incontinence Previous pelvic radiation therapy Requirement Substitute Decision Maker Inability attend workshop Unwilling attend Englishlanguage workshop Unwilling complete Englishlanguage survey
